title: Jai Hind!
review: Must visit. I had goosebumps while browsing through the details.

title: History revisited
review: This place gives an insight about the veer Garwal Rifles and Garwali culture. The museum is home to some rare medals, guns, ammunitions, books, war dresses and lots of history about Garwalis who served during world war. Do read about Rifleman Gabar Singh Negi, recipient of Victoria Cross, who lost his life at the age of 19 while serving British India in WW-I. It's a beautiful place. Please remember that this place besides museum is a war memorial, so please do maintain a level of dignity and respect. There is ample parking space and entry fees is Rs. 20 per adult.

title: History can be revisited
review: You see weapons, medals and different types of uniforms of men of Garhwal Rifles who earned glory during the World War One . Even one of them earned Victoria cross also .

title: Historical defense museum
review: It's a museum of The Garhwal Rifles in Lansdowne. It's a well maintained museum with information and details about the Garhwal Rifle of the Indian Army. Since there are limited sightseeing options in Lansdowne, you should consider visiting the museum also.

title: Museum
review: Only 4 km from Blue Pine Resort and cool place to visit for travellers like us. My parents enjoyed a lot.

title: Nice museum
review: Nice collection of garwal regiment from coins to medal. Also,showing the first world war guns. Small place but nice things to showcase about their history of regiment

title: A must visit place in Lansdowne
review: The first Victoria cross to Indian Army was given to Darwan singh of Garhwal regiment . A great museum shows complete movie about the glorious Garhwal regiment and great antique weaponary to see .

title: Tryst with history
review: This museum is like a book. Provides loads of knowledge about army and Agarwal history. Nucely maintained and clean.

title: Must Visit Museum
review: I would recommend you must visit this musuem if you are in or around Lansdowne... Well maintained and gives you amazing insights into the history of Garwal rifles...If you love Army then you would love this museum...

title: Visit to one the Gorkhas 😍😍
review: Lastly v r their in Dec. 2014. The 2014 option isnt their.V have visited Lansdowne more than once. Gr8 to know sooo much about our soldiers, about this regiment. Their works nd duties cannot be explained just in words. Just 1 word to say, it's really very very true nd mere words are short for description . "Aap hain rooh haam hain", "Aap hain tooh haam hain". Kudos to you, keep going aur warriors. Keep going. Vvv r always with you forever nd ever. ️

title: Good insight into Indian Armed Force
review: If you are interested in putting your kids into Army, then this place can be really a booster for them. It's a place which gracefully shows the MARTYERS OF INDIAN ARMY, GARHWAL RIFLES with their history and heroism. There is also this cute little model of INS VIKRANT along with other armoury. Rifles find a good place here with British India barrels to present day rifles. Manuscripts, memoirs, medals and war weapons are some of the things which are showcased here.  It also showcases the longest barrel of Garhwal Rifles. There is a small entrance fee to it which can be paid in cash. From the entrance of the Museum, one can also see the Army Parade Ground. If you are lucky, you might also get to see the parade which is carried out in this ground.

title: Well Maintained
review: We visited Museum in month of May. For non-military personnel, they have entry ticket of Rs 20 per head. But it is worth spend, as museum is well maintained with lot of information on Lansdowne area and World War I. There is an open parking available near to museum.

title: Sneak peak into history of Garhwal Rifles
review: This Museum is mostly focussed on Garhwal rifles, a proud part of India armed forces. History of this rifles goes back to 1890s and that's what you will see in the museum. You will be able to see portraits of valiant warriors, rifles, rocket launchers, medals, uniforms etc.

title: glory of Gorkha Rifles.
review: The museum is dedicated to Gorkha Rifles. It highlights the dresses and arms of the Gorkha Rifles used in different times and also the medals won by its Army-men.

title: Feel of Patriotism
review: Go before 5 and enjoy small collection of army artefacts. Do not use your camera inside but see the the real time history.

title: A visit as a tribute to The Garhwal Rifles - the most  decorated infantry regiment of Indian army.
review: 1. Visit this place

title: Good place
review: Good place. Very silent. Entry fee is only Rs 20 per person. There isn't much to see in Lansdowne and this takes 15 mins.

title: A proud regiment and it's accomplishments
review: A treasure trove interested in military history. Or for those exceedingly patriotic ones.

title: Very Fortunate
review: A brief display to arms, ammunition that has been used by Indian Army or has been seized during wars

title: HOME TO 36RR
review: A great museum to visit ..showcasing the valour of 36RR men.Refrain from bringing your toddler's . Amazing artifacts present .

title: Well kept
review: A well-kept museum. A ticket of 40 rs is charged with a discount to defence personals.We walked to the museum enjoying the sights and scenes around.

title: Feel proud when you visit this museum in Lansdowne
review: One will be filled with gratitude on the visit to this famous Darwan Singh Museum in Lansdowne. A historical museum named after the first Victoria cross holder from Garhwal Rifles,Darwan Singh Negi. Located near the Parade ground of Lansdowne this museum is a must visit place when you are on your vacations to Lansdowne.

title: Well kept and informative
review: Situated near the parade ground, this museum offers a nice display related to Garhwal Rifles. Lucky that we had our shoes on, there were others who were in floaters and slippers and they were denied an entry.

title: Good but not great!
review: The location of this place is jussttt amazing as its in the army area of garwal rifles!.. the museum has a lot of information related to garwal rifles which I found intersting.

title: A well maintained museum
review: Darwan Singh Museum is a well kept musuem where one can see arms and ammunitions used in the war. I was astonished to saw different types of guns, machine guns and rocket launcher. 40 rs ticket is charged for entry. Location is very near to the market and kept very clean by the army persons.

title: Salute to Garhwal Regiment...
review: One of the must visit place when you are on your vacation to Lansdowne..The place is around 800 meters from the main market.You need to pay an entry fee to explore the museum..

title: Garhwal rifles museum
review: Excellent collection of pictures, facts and articles depicting the history of Garhwal Rifles and its contribution to Indian Army over the years since its formation

title: Ignites patriotism
review: Superb display of Armed forces medals, weapons and pearls of Garhwal Regiment.It is a good tour for the history buffs.

title: Darwan singh museum
review: Darwan singh museum is must watch well mangaged by Garwal rifal, and history of Garwal Rifals. I love this place

title: War related museum
review: There is one gun which has the longest barrel and one soldier will keep the barrel on shoulder and second soldier will set aim and fire it. It's 9/10 ft long gun.

title: Pride of Army
review: A must visit place for all who love their country and understands the sacrifice of army men. Wonderful history of Garhwal Rifles with original manuscripts, maps and photos.

title: It's a place worth visiting in Lansdowne
review: If you want to have a glimpse of the kind or armaments were used by erstwhile defense forces, and also the wars fought, you should definitely visit this museum. I found it the same as one in the Ranikhet.

title: A must visit place in lansdowne !!!
review: Warriors meuseum. Meuseum is basically based on Garhwal regiment history, after going it through you will feel proud for them. you will find images of the officers, arms over there.

title: Immerse in the valour  of garhwalis
review: A huge collection of medals and memoirs of garhwal regiment. The  weapons on display are quite a sight.

title: love army
review: nice and lovable.. army memories was very nice and well maintained and decorated ... place was very nice and clean lansdowne

title: An army meuseum that will fill u with pride
review: You would be amazed as you enter the museum. Being a normal civilian you just fantasize of army life. But entering here you get to see history of our army. Various arms and ammunitions used over the time. It will make you both proud and happy. There is an entrance fee and it takes about half n hour to see the place. Its a must visit if you want to experience the army life and history.

title: Somber and humbling
review: Walking through the corridors of this museum, one is filled with reverence and gratitude for the ultimate sacrifices our Army has made for our security and freedom...

title: Great fighters museum
review: Darban singh negi fought with birtishers it has timings for entry from 9 am to 12 am,and 4 pm to 6 pm.

title: Fantastic, hair raising!
review: The stories, the rifles, the heroism, the discipline of the place.. all well worth the visit! I enjoyed with my eldest son (9 years old).

title: Army museum
review: it is a museum of the gharwal rifles displaying historic pictures, arms etc. Place remains closed on Wednesday.

title: nice museum
review: IT was an honor to visit this museum and see the history of GARWAL RIFLES and the various arms that were used by them over the years.

title: Inspirational!
review: Well maintained, has lot of

title: Interesting but not as expected
review: Garhwali Rifles has an old history of courage and honor but the museum does not have enough information as expected. Its good but a huge scope of improvement.

title: Army museum
review: This is a well maintained museum with minimal entry fees and has quite a few war mementos and other British imperial paraphernalia. Some weapons are also displayed.

title: Know the Garwal Regiment
review: This museum has the history of Garwal, including kings and regiment. One should visit the place while in Lansdown.

title: nice collection of antiques
review: there is huge collection guns dresses and other item of garwal history. old thing for kids as they could learn about our rich past

title: History of local regiment
review: If you are patriotic, you can visit this museum operated by the Defense. You can see the rich history of the local regiment.

title: For Military History Buffs
review: The museum is a tribute to the Garwal Rifles and emphasises their long and rich military history. Take your time and absorb the artefacts and writings that describe them.

title: a peak into Garhwal regiment
review: the name of the museum is after India's first non commissioned officer to receive the Victoria Cross in 1914.

title: Makes you proud
review: A very good museum. Makes one aware of the immense contribution our army has to our peaceful life. It is all about the achievements of Garhwal Rifles. Many places felt a lump in throat at the immense sacrifices and hardships endured by our Jawans. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Take Pride on Indian Army !
review: Lansdowne as most of you would be knowing is army base for the Garhwal regiment to be precise. Darwan Singh Museum is one such place where you can look into the history of Uttarakhand and Garhwal regiment in detail.

title: Good Collection of Army Stuffs
review: This is museum has some really old stuff that belongs to indian army since the british rule. You can gain some good knowledge from this Museum. It's located very near to lansdowne market. There is a entry fee for civilians rs 60 per person (till 05/9/2016). You can see some good collections of old guns, dresses of army from british rule etc.

title: Nice museum
review: Museum is small place though you will see Gallantary awards of various people from Garhwal regiment with few vintage Guns and weapons. We found jawans training and practicing in the ground which was the best part to see.

title: Proud Garwal Regiment History
review: War heroes.. guns, medals & trophies right from the world war era on display. Gives a brief of the Garwal Heroes & the action they have been a part of over the period of time

title: Very Good
review: To View the Glory and Things Captured During war of 1971. Also outside in the parade Ground you can see Soldiers practicing Skills of Parade.

title: Nice place!
review: I loved this museum. One feels very patriotic after witnessing the museum. One must visit here.It is one of the attractions of Lansdowne.

title: so so
review: this place can be on your list only for the surround view.unless u have a lot of time in which case u can visit the museum

title: A must visit place at Lansdowne
review: Darwan Singh Army Museum is located close to State Bank of India, Lansdowne. The heroic contributions made by the Garhwal regiment in fighting many wars, including World War 1 & 2, UN peacekeeping missions, rescuing people during natural calamities etc have been very nicely portrayed. The museum has also on display many objects of historical importance, like Guns, Canons, Uniforms, old coins etc. The stories of sacrifices made by brave Garhwalis made us feel proud of them. This museum is a must visit place for every patriotic Indian, coming to Lansdowne

title: A Tribute to The Garhwalis
review: Beautifully laid out and displayed museum. Quite awesome! The valor and might of the Garhwalis on display.

title: Go only if you are a history buff
review: Clean and neat surroundings. Well maintained garden around it. Good only if you are a history buff else you would just look at the things in fascination and move ahead like us!!

title: Good to have army feel
review: Its a nice point, closed at 12 noon, opened at 4 pm in evening. it gives a feel of the regiment posted here. The army pared ground behind it is worth seing

title: You will feel proud of the army
review: Lansdowne is not a place where you have so many things to do, or many places to visit. The time spent in the museum is well spent! The well maintained area, disciplined army people and the achievements of the army depicted within the museum makes you proud about   the army.

title: Gallery of Glorious past
review: One must visit this place to see what is left of old times. Make sure that you confirm the open and close timings of this museum. Entry to this museum is chargeable.

title: Visit
review: We went to lansdowne in the summer vacations.

title: Army in full glory
review: Darwan Singh Negi was the earliest recipients of the Victoria Cross (VC), the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry. He was just 33 years old, in Garhwal Rifles. His regiment has set up a museum in his memorial. It houses all kinds of arms and ammunition used by Garhwal Rifles ever since it's inception. Do many medals, so many trophies.. you just feel proud of your armed forces.

title: Jai Ho Feelings
review: It has everything the army is proud of, we went there with family and friends and enjoyed the place.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Very nicely kept and maintained, to showcases the proud and rich history of Garwal Rifles. Very clean and quite place. There is an entry fee attached.

title: Worth a visit once
review: Its a curator of history of Garhwal rifles showcasing the weapons, documents and records. Outside the museum, the jawans could be seen drilling.

title: army museum
review: its a museum recording and showcasing the history and glory of garhwal rifles. it makes one realize the efforts and achievements of the army and is very educative in that way

title: Nice Museum with good collection of Garwhal Rifles
review: Nice place to visit in Lansdowne

title: Great museum with details of our brave soldiers
review: A must visit place located in the cantonment area. It contains the info about the brave soldiers of a India, their success stories, medals won by them. Also some of the old weapons.

title: Proud Place to Visit
review: Museum is placed adjacent to  beautiful Parade ground of Gharwal Rifles. Felt proud to see the various collection of Medals. Thrilled to see the Ashok Chakra and various other medals. Great historic collection of the Gharwal Rifles. Awesome collection of various Roses and other flowers outside the Museum.

title: Weekend tripping
review: One of the best place to visit in lansdown where u will feel the nature and feel like indian...i can enjoy the show for 60rs anf get more details of the museum

title: Patrioyic place
review: A must visit place for all the patriotics. You can watch the Jawans of Indian military practicing and marching in the grounds of the academy. Inside the museum you can see and feel weapons are arsenal used in wars by Indian army. You get to learn a lot of history.

title: Do not Miss it
review: The glorious history of Garwhal Rifles is on display. Give atleast 1 hour to go through all the details.

title: A well maintained Museum
review: It is a war memorial for martyrs & decorated soldiers of Garhwal Rifles. Very well maintained. Worth a visit.

title: Perfect place to visit to get a glimpse of our brave soldiers!
review: A must visit place in Lansdowne where, if lucky, you can get to see the parade, winning medals, various types of guns used in the wars, costumes etc. Makes you feel proud of our Indian Army!

title: Cherish History
review: Nice place to visit to cherish and know our old history. different type of Rifles, bombs, sword are kept there. Many Medals are maintained

title: Typical garhwal regiment meuseum
review: This meuseum shows the history of garhwal army. Nice monuments are collected in there. Place is peaceful and shows the courage and achivements of Indian army.

title: A Very Beautiful Army Museum
review: A Very Beautiful Army Museum.Those who loves history and wants to know about golden history of indian army especially Galrwal regiment then this is the place to be in.Though I personally felt the entry fees (around 60 per person) are a bit on the higher side but one one must keep in mind that army spens lot of money in maintaining the museum and the garden and place around it. You can spend around 1-1:30 in this place.

title: Indian army is world best army with such high spirits.
review: Awsome place,very well maintained by our army good record kept by army, must visit.If you people ever got chance to visit Lansdowne, don't miss an opportunity to visit this museum maintained by garwali regiment,you people would love to see ancient guns and fire ball launchers used by our army a decade before.

title: KNOW YOUR WARRIORS
review: A classic walk through rich Military history and tale of courage of THE GREAT GARHWAL soldiers. An exceptional depiction of the events of past and pride of our Indian bravery.Must visit and do give some time to go through.

title: Nice museum
review: it is a museum with information and insight on the Garhwal Regiment in Indian Army. Photography is not permitted inside the museum.

title: A lesson in military history
review: One of the best war and military history museums you will ever find...guns,cannons and other arms dot the museum.

title: Interesting place!
review: Being a camp area that Lansdowne is, this place sure says all about the history of the area. It is one of the best place around Lansdowne and offers everything about the war history of this place and the Garhwal Rifles! Jai JAwaan!

title: One of the better attractions in Lansdowne
review: Quick facts:

title: A museum of Gharwal Rifles
review: When you visit Lansdowne the hometown of Gharwal Rifles one should visit this museum. It is nicely maintained and well presented. One should not miss the statue of a Gharwali soldier popularly known as war memorial

title: Glory of Garwal Rifles
review: Must place  to visit and see the Glory of Garwal Rifles  and about Indian army. Children should be taken there to get inspired on seeing the contribution of Garwal regiment in various wars

title: Must visit in Lansdowne
review: Must visit this museum maintained & managed by Garwal Rifles.. look into history of Lansdowne & Garwal rifle & an opportunity to pay homage to Martyrs, Ask if you can be lucky to see their motorcycle show

title: Nice experience for anybody
review: really motivating and inspiring to visit this museum anybody will feel motivated by watching the garwhal rifles museum .

title: Army Museum
review: Nice Place for a person who is interested in knowing arms and army. ₹50/- for a ticket to visit this museum. You will found this place boring if you are not interested in knowing some of the information from history.

title: a patriotic mueseum
review: i love such kinds of museum which makes us remind about our soldiers efforts to give us a sound sleep...this museum is one of them it shows the efforts and  achievements of garhwal regiment and i so proud that they belong to our country...jai hind jai garhwal

title: superb museum to know Garhwal Rifles tales of valour !
review: The museum has timings for opening/closing & open on payment basis only. It shows lots n lots of pictures, stories, conquests.

title: superb museum to know Army History
review: this museum shows the efforts and achievements of garhwal regiment. i love the section in which they shows there Weapons.

title: Jai hind !
review: A very nice place to know about the regiment and force. also lots of historical things have been there. Must visit

title: Darwan Singh Museum
review: It is a very small museum and the entry ticket of Rs 50/- is a bit high for it. There are some interesting items kept in the museum and it is worth visiting once.

title: Museum History of Garwal Rifiles
review: This musuem will give you insight about Garwal Rifles. Weapons you can see different type of pistol and riffles. There dresses which was used during history of garwal rifles.

title: guns and guns and story of glory
review: located at the walkable stretch from the central market, the museum preserves clear story of the glory of Gharwal Rifels. Different kind of guns, medal collections, dress and decorated uniforms makes this place really vibrant. due to less foot fall - the space is pretty good to peacefully spend some quality time. Kids are not allowed to prevent the noise and unwanted damage of the stuffs inside. Nice small flowerbed at the entrance is awesome.

title: Must visit, interesting exhibits
review: One can spend a good 2 hours here, looking at the interesting exhibits and learning more about the fascinating history of the Garhwal Rifles.

title: A place of honor for army..
review: It has photos, old records , swords and tools used in wars.Good place for history lovers ..It just cost 50 bucks per person..

title: History revisted
review: Very well maintained by the army. So much cleanliness and discipline. A nominal entry fee.Wish there was a guide also to explain the historical

title: MEMORIAL ITEMS
review: Darban singh museum is based on the weapons used in war its a very nice place they will display the items used in wars.

title: Garhwal Rifles museum
review: This museum houses relics of Garhwal Regiment. Photography absolutely prohibited in and around, sentries are on watch. Admission of small children prohibited, but you can convince the sentry.

title: Army museum
review: good building and good collection, keep one and half hours for this place. doesn't have CCTV or traditional security measures as other places are having so some time people take undue advantage like touching the collections, clicking or talking loud.

title: Good Place for Military History
review: A very well maintained museum. It houses pieces of history worth seeing, citations for VCs and other awards and tells you about how Lansdowne came to be established. It is a must see place. One can spend at least one hour here.

title: Nice Army Museum
review: This is an army museum stating about the contributions of Garhwali Rifles during different wars and natural disasters.

title: Army Museum
review: A good place to visit and see the grand display of Army Grahwal Regiment.

title: Must visit to this museam
review: Excellent place for museum lovers and have taste of how our soldiers have fought and live in difficult times, with view of different types of guns, and arms and ammunition used by Gharwal rifles

title: A big salute to our brave soilders
review: A must visit for first time travellers to Lansdowne town. A very well maintained museum dedicated to the brave officers and jawans of the Garwhal Rifles Regiment with an amazing exhibition of their history

title: Museum is one time watch
review: It  has lots of ancient pictures from World War I and II. Good collection of old rifles, bullets. Its quite big in size.

title: A 'Must Visit Once' Place in Lansdowne
review: The museum is a rich collection of old war and colonial era memorabilia reflecting the tradition of gallantry by Garhwal Rifles. The place also displays information on the history of Lansdowne town and neighboring area. There is a small fee to visit the museum. Children below 6 years are not allowed in, but with a gentle request to the guard and an assurance that you take full responsibility, you might be able to take your toddler in. However, the place is best avoided if you have lots of small kids as the artifacts on display are irreplaceable if damaged. Take your time reading the descriptions. My teenage son was disappointed to find several descriptions of guns on display missing. The descriptions of weapons can be expanded beyond their names to include information on their range, accuracy and firing mechanism etc. Overall it was a very informative visit. The Garhwal Rifles parade ground is right adjacent to the museum. So, if you visit between 4:00 to 5:30 in the evening, there is a good chance of you finding soldiers practicing their marching skills with an army band playing along. Nearby attractions include a children's park with lots of rabbits and pigeons and a mountain trail called 'Thandi Sadak' where you can spot lots of birds during the day. There are no food joints nearby.

title: Revisit our heritage and leave with a smile and proud feeling
review: For 30 years of my life I was fed by mass media the tiny bits of information about what is the heritage of our armed forces. It happens for brief moments during conflicts on borders, prize distributions, on 26 Jan parade, etc. Here, in this museum, you can take your own time to immerse completely in a life-long achievements of Garhwal Rifles.

title: Salute to Garwal Rifle Veterans
review: The museum is part of the Garhwal Rifle Centre and open to public. It is dedicated to memory of one of its soldier who won Victoria Cross during the great wars. The place has usual regimental memorabilia including its story of development, various commanders, soldiers who have won war honours and those who have laid their life defending the honour of their force and the nation. Various weapons used by the regiment are also on display. The book of honour is displayed which has entries of all the members who have laid down their life. One is expected to salute and honour the book in memory of the martyrs. The entry to the museum is on payment which is suppose to be used for the welfare of soldiers. One can see recruits being grilled to make them soldiers in the big grounds opposite to the museum

title: Very informative
review: This museum is not only about garwhal rifles history,you will also find sufficient information on lansdowne history and culture.

title: Must see museum
review: Good collection of medals old arms and military uniforms.  Sad, photography is not allowed in the museum or towards the parade ground.  There are a good number of shops by the defense personnel family welfare society, selling curios, clothes and leather goods.

title: Must Visit if Interested in History or Army
review: Nice Place to read & know about the complete History of Lansdowne Cantt & Garhwal Rifles from its establishment in 1887 till date. Must Visit if you feel even a small interest in History or a small speck of respect or awe for the Indian Army

title: good
review: lots and lots of interesting information regarding the brave garwal rifles battalion and their stories filled with awards, ammuniation, rifles, guns, gallantary awards

title: Well maintained museum
review: The museum offers a peek into the rich and glorious history of Garhwal Rifles. The whole cantonment area including the parade ground and the museum is sparkling clean and orderly and beautifully maintained. The parade ground is a huge plain ground in the hilly surroundings. Also in the morning there is a parade, which I missed.

title: History of the Garwhal Rifles all in one place!
review: At this museum we can learn everything about the Garwhal Rifles. There are exhibits showing each of the campaigns the regiment participated in. Very interesting museum. The highlight is that amongst the medal collection there is a Victoria Cross!

title: Nice collection
review: This is very good museum and nocely msintained. It has nice collection og guns and medals.

title: Great Memorials Meausum
review: Great Collections of the memories of  war fighters. Pleasant and clean museum. Contains China and Pakistan war related fighters arms.

title: History
review: The museum gives the visitor a quick tour of the history of the Garhwal Rifles Regiment. Arms, medals, archival photographs, trophies and a lot of background material keeps one engrosed

title: Nice Museum
review: Good collection of artefacts - Tickets too pricey. Very nicely maintained. A tuck shop or cafeteria for visitors would have made this more place more memorable.

title: All about Gorkha Rifles and their brave History
review: If you want to know the extent of bravery by Gorkha Rifles then you should visit this place. Its walking distance from the market and couple of hours can be spent there easily when one has completed all the attractions of Lansedowne and want a stroll in the market.

title: Nice Museum
review: You will able to see so many things. inside the Museum. But the Entry charge was very expensive. Very Big Parade Ground.

title: Evening Visit
review: Nice and well maintained museum by Indian Army, Located in center of Lansdowne. It is the best place for peolpe who loves history.

title: Nice War Memorial
review: Go there to visit Glory of Gharwal Rifles. you can see parade also from there. you will get to know the complete history of lansdown and can see gallantry medals also..

title: nice museum
review: well maintained museum by army. has lot of memorable things to see. pls check the timings before going. also it is closed (as far as i remember on tuesdays). ticket is cheap.

title: Salute to Martyrs- Garhwali Veer.
review: My Grandfather (Aditya Ram) used to tell me a poem that goes like this  :

title: Nice experience
review: One of the best place to visit in Lansdowne specially who wants to explore history about Indian Army.

title: A visit to glory
review: The Darwan Singh Museum tell the glorious past of Garwal Rifles. Gallantry Medals since British Raj and  captured ammunition are displayed. Feeling proud after watching the museum. A must visit attraction.

title: Small but ok
review: It is a dedicated military museum.Ticket price is too high 50 rs where as taj mahal ticket is now 20 rs only!!!Nothing special..

title: Nice Peek into history
review: Very well maintained monument since world war 1. Lots of armour used in real war on display with proper history mentioned.

title: must visit
review: old rifles and guns,even the one which was used in first world war,history of garhwaal rifles resiments is interesting

title: Army Museum: Good to see
review: Went as a routine part of sight seeing. Well managed by the forces. The history of Indian army can be seen.

title: Salute to the warriors!
review: For the first time we learnt the history of Garwhal Rifles through the memoraibilia.The weapons,band,coins,medals helped to transport us to the bravery of army!

title: Interesting
review: Very informative and interesting place to visit. One should go for this at any cost. It is in Cantonment area

title: Good to know history before the visit...
review: This place has all historical collections related to army.. like guns, various items like knives and machine guns captured during war with adjacent countries.. gifts given to our army men by other countries for their bravery..etc.. Good place to visit in lansdowne since there is nothing much to visit otherwise.

title: Can a learn about the GRRC
review: We reached around 3.00 p.m. and the museum was closed. However, the waiting time was well spent watching training being given to the cadets (?) in the large regimental ground.  The museum opened a little after 3.30 p.m. One should spend some time here to learn about the heroics and great contributions of Garhwal Rifles.  Interesting museum. Entrance fee Rs. 50 per person.

title: Gharwal rifles history !
review: Like the war memorial and felt proud of our national heroes and there courageous acts . Must visit for all Indians . But I have a suggestion for museum authorities that memorial was looking pro monarch!

title: Must visit this place
review: Very well maintained museum. You get to know about historic guns, artillery, soldier uniforms, their badges and madels collected since the era of british rule. Got to know so much about Garhwal Regiment. Loved this place.

title: Must see...
review: A great place to feel pride on Indian Army and specially for Garhwal Regiment. The muesum is well decorated and maintained. Must to see every travelers visiting Lansdowne.

title: Admire the history
review: The place is well maintained. My 8 year old son ejoyed the armours and other traditional things which were out of the world to him

title: Great
review: Very good museum, gharwal rifles and their great journey. Very good for kids. one should keep it itenerary while in lansdowne.

title: Jai Hind
review: Best Museum in a hill station. With many articles during the world war era...one can witness the great spirit of the soilders

title: The Brave Garhwali
review: The museum is excellent and it is felt quite astonished that british era maps are kept here.    The museum also teaches us the lesson of upkeeping the tradition and to do the efforts not y in the battle field but in any sphere of life with zeal, dedication and sincerity which ultimately generates a feeling of true spiritual satisfaction which cannot be brought by crores of rupees, dollars or pounds.

title: Nice collection
review: The museum has good collections relating to Garwal rifles. History goes back to almost a century. Very well managed by the Army.

title: Swollen with pride!
review: Having been to the Army Museum in Shimla the last year, I knew I wanted to visit the Garhwali Museum in Lansdowne. Set near the parade ground and war memorial, the museum traces the history of the Garhwal Rifles, who call Lansdowne home. Right from pre-independence wars to as late as Kargil, the museum will make the hearts of Indians swell with pride.

title: A keeper of history
review: This museum holds glories of Garhwal. Won't take more than an hour to cover the whole place, but do visit if you wish to feel the pride that they do from their service of the nation.

title: A must to visit for all visitors to know heroic deed of our Country's Great Army, in particular of Garhwal Riflles.
review: One is spellbound to see the great jobs done by Indian Army' Garhwal Rifles and its's great Traditions.

title: must visit in Lansdowne
review: If you visit Lansdowne and do not go to this museum , it will be really an injustice to the place and the brave soldiers of Garhwal Rifles. The regiment which played significant role in 65 PAK war and Kargil war has depicted its history, arms, coins and medals very well in the museum.

title: Garhwal Rifles and its glory
review: Darwan Singh Museum is one of the better and must see attractions of Lansdowne. Located in the centre of the town, the museum displays the might of Garhwal Rifles, both in India and abroad, at different times of war and peace. Maintained by the military, it has a good collection of arms, ammunitions, as well as texts associated with Garhwal Rifles and history of Lansdowne. There is no point in visiting Lansdowne and giving this museum a miss!

title: Good museum for war time antiques and badges
review: A great museum for war time badges and history of gharwal riffles. Go if you are into all that. Else, you should avoid

title: Knowledge about world war 1 and 2
review: I like the old French and Japanese guns displayed in museum. Information about courageous troop members who single hand manage to stop China from intervene territory for 3 days.  He was shot dead however still his clothes are being ironed, shoes are polished till date as his spirit is still there to protect.

title: Feeling proud of the Garhwal regiment
review: DARWAN SINGH MUSEUM

title: A standard army museum
review: It is a standard army museum with memoirs from wars and important events.

title: Pride of the Nation, Must See for Patriots
review: This is the museum of the Garhwal Regiment - one of the most decorated units of the Indian army. The museum contains many of the invaluable medals and honours that the members of the regiment have won over the years. More importantly all the stories of the bravery of the men are written down to remind us of their sacrifices.

title: in lansdowne , u must visit this place
review: BEing garhwali myslef never knew about Garhwal regiment till now. When i visited this place came to know abt history of this place and long and glorious past of this Regiment

title: Excellent place...
review: A great place for getting a glimpse of glorious history of garhwal regiment. Detailed history, soldier's uniform, crosses n medals which adorned the soldiers at one point of time are tastefully displayed. Amazing place for kids n adults alike who are interested in war history.

title: Only if you enjoy history...
review: One of the few sites in the small, quaint Lansdowne town. The museum gives a good perspective of the history of the Garhwal Rifles. Not for kids (and they say the same, kids below 10 years not  allowed), go here only if you enjoy history. Unfortunately, some of the places like the parade ground and the war memorial are out of bounds for the public at large, but are good as photographic memories

title: A nice Tribute to Garhwal Heroes
review: This Museum in Lansdowne is dedicated to heroes and history of Gharwal Rifles who have their headquarter at Lansdowne.There is entry fee of Rs 50 and children below 10 are not allowed. A nice collection of photographs, arms and certificates depicting the glofry of Garhwal Rifles.Nicely maintained .

title: Good collection
review: Very good collection maintained spic and span by the Garhwal Regiment. Normally children are not allowed but it was a weekday and as an exception I could take my toddler in provided she doesnt touch the exhibits.

title: Nice to see palce
review: It's all about the soldiers who belong to Lansdowne and fight for war on India. You can reach with your own vehicle to it's gate. Cameras are not allowed inside. They will not provide you a locker/Slip/token to deposit it.

title: well maintained historical place
review: With a miniscule entry charge, this Museum overlooking the Drill Square and War Memorial at the Garhwal Rifles Regimental Centre is a must see for all those who are interested in history and traditions of the Indian Army and a wonderful breed of valiant soldiers.

title: BEAUTIFUL HISTORY!!!
review: The museum takes back u to the history of garhwal and all the wars fought by them.The weapons and crockery used in ancient India.Beautiful history of garhwal.

title: Enlighten your knowledge about WW1 and WW2
review: We Indians take pride in our history but I am not sure if all of us know about the contribution Indian soldiers has in World War 1 and II. Visit this place to know about the same.

title: Best attraction
review: Unexpectedly I found it as one of the best attractions in lansdowne. I planned max 30 mins stay here but ended up 1.5 hours inside. This place has history of garwal regiment with many pictures, weapons, medals, etc. It also has few old maps of lansdowne. Best thing was it told me many facts about Indian army and its operations carried out by brave soldiers of garwal regiment.

title: Salute to Garhwal Regiment
review: Must visit place that showcases the Great History of garhwal regiment....has nice collections of rifles both old and modern...

title: Church turned war museum
review: A must visit place while in Lansdowne! The location is beautiful, overlooking the valley,with the snow capped peaks forming a wonderful back drop in clear day!the church looks very stately,the interior has been converted to a war memorial for all the brave Gardwalis who have held pride of places in the current Indian Army and erstwhile British Army! There is a documentary film depicting the transformation of a few villages on the hill to a wonderful Army cantonment. It also chronicles the valiant contribution of the Gardwalis in the various wars India had to fight before and after Independence.A visit to this memorial will fill every Indian with pride!

title: Garhwal Rifles Headquarter
review: I find a regimental museum  - After visiting i found very rare collection of rifles and armaments. I wanted to click the snaps from my mobile but cant.  I also found that the Garhwal Rifles is the only one who took top disciplinary awards most of the time. One must go there once if visited Lansdawne.

title: Makes you feel proud...
review: This is by the SBI branch in Lansdowne. Its both a meditation place and a museum . There is entry charges of Rs 50 per person. Photography is not allowed inside.

title: Good to know about our great jawans
review: The museum is a great place to know and appreciate the valour and spirit of the garhwal regiment jawans

title: must see place in Lansdowne
review: I would like to go again to this place  Lansdowne

title: very informative
review: An amazing and different experience for children and elders to see, read and understand the development of the Indian army and various battles- how they were fought.

title: Gud display of indian army history
review: The museum is nicely designed within a small space, with lot of information about origin and achievements of gharwal army right from pre-independence area to recent kargil war.lots of memorabilia and historical letters and certificates on display along with antique weapons of warfare and coins/currency

title: Salute to Garwal Regiment.
review: Superb experience of Darwan Singh Museum where we found history of Garwal regiment. Salute to Mr. Negi who was the leader of Garwal regiment in early days. There were many photos where my tears comes when I saw the sacrifices done by our soldiers during the war with China. Very old guns & mountain climbing tools i saw which were used by our soldiers to climb & recorded history to Mount Everest. Salute to my great soldiers.

title: A place to kill time
review: Its a small museum where few arms and many verity of medals are kept. They charge Rs.50/- per person.

title: Good Musem dedicated to Garwal Rifles
review: Rs 50/- per entry ticket. Its an honour you give to the army persons who have sacrificed for the country. Must visit.

title: good old place
review: its a nice place for everyone and gets you closer to gharwali people and army. well maintained and clean contonment area. Thanks gharwal regiment

title: Must visit place
review: You will like it to be part of Indian Military. Tip N top is next to it. Also, there is Army Canteen and a sweet shop next to it. Take Lansdowne special chocolate and Burfis from there.

title: Its nice...
review: Nice place and have some really antique collections.

title: Garhwal history
review: This is a museum located within the army cantonment having a gallery of pictures, artifacts and objects from old war. Since Lansdowne is the base for Garhwal Rifles, most of the objects in the museum reflect the history of this regiment

title: A good insight on History
review: Though the place is in the main city not all would be very keen visiting here as it is a bit aloof though very nicely maintained.

title: Nice guns and history
review: The museum is open from 9 to 12 on holidays. Entry fees is 50 Rs per adult. The museum has the entire history of garhwal rifles. There are loads of guns and revolvers. Lot of accounts of garhwal rifles in different wars. It was a nice brush with history.

title: A salute to Garwhal Rifles!
review: Collection on display is rare, pictures, medals, old rifles & pistols, photography is restricted. The whole place reminds you of how brave & patriotic our indian armed forces are.

title: Exhaustive research on history
review: The museum has some exhaustive research on history ... particularly Garhwali history, complemented by historical artifacts which includes ofcourse - guns, swords, medals, etc.

title: amazing collection
review: The Darwan Singh Museum is a place you have to visit.The museum is loaded with old guns,books,records,maps and cannons.You cannot photograph pictures here.It is situated in the cantonment area,near the army ground.But one thing by which i was not satisfied was that the entry has to be free as Garhwal Rifles should show their history and achievements.But still,it is very good.

title: Best place to know about the Garhwal Rifle Regiment
review: Here the history and achievements of Garhwal Rifle is well documented. They have won  numerous battles for our country.This museum silently tells those stories.

title: Eye opener
review: Very informative. Lots of interesting facts and display items. Wish I could go around on the area.

title: Worth a visit.
review: Well maintained, and well documente history of the Garhwal regiment.

title: Museum
review: If you want to know the history of the Garowal , Garowal Kingdom, many war heroes , then go there. Lots of learning experience. Surroundings looks like that you had visited a European country. One "Tamra Patra" from Treta Yug is the major show of the museum.

title: Must see
review: Keep a full afternoon free. You will be amazed at the variety and the little stories in there. Just reading about how the three Victoria Cross were won by the Garhwal Rifles is treat enough. The captured arsenal from the battles of First and Second World Wars and numerous campaigns around the world are interesting too. Unfiorms of yore also make quiet an interesting statement. Of course, the photographs of the present COs and Subedar Majors of he various Garhwat Rifles units is only an exercise in vanity, Im afraid. Rest of the museum is superb.
